Five major WNV lineages have been described according to the genomic phylogenies, where lineage 1 is widely distributed throughout Africa, Asia and America [ 42]. However, other lineages also circulate in Europe where lineage 2 may cause human infections [ 48]. The partial WNV sequences characterized in mosquito pools in this study grouped phylogenetically with lineage 1 clade 1a sequences, which include the majority of the global lineage 1 strains as well as previously characterized sequences in Anatolia [ 11]. However, a significant WNV sequence diversity has also been documented in Turkey [ 16, 42], which is represented in this study as differential clustering of mosquito, avian and equine sequences (
Fig 2 ). This pronounced diversity, as well as occasional detection of lineage 2 strains [ 49], probably results from independent virus introductions and dispersion via migrating birds throughout Anatolia and Thrace [ 43].
